title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.5: RISK INFORMED ED. POLICIES

description.narrative: By 2020, educational institutions have strengthened capacity to respond in situation of crises, emergencies and disasters, which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children aged 3 to 16, especially girls from the most disadvantaged regions, have increased and equitable access to quality early childhood development and gender responsive basic education services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, educational institutions have strengthened capacity to respond in situation of crises, emergencies and disasters

description.narrative: In 2020, the Country office, as lead of the Education-in-emergency group, supported the sector emergency response to floods, the COVID-19 response, and the electoral crisis. Funds were reprogrammed and important additional resources were mobilized, including USD 11 million from the Global Partnership for Education (GPE). | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
